author: bayard
msg: An XmlWriter class. It is designed to make outputting Xml easy with a
Writer-style pattern of usage. That is, you don't have to build up a large
XML tree and then serialise that large tree, instead you just push the data
out as and when you are finished with it.
The major opposition I am aware of to this class are JDOM and ECS. ECS falls
over when it hits larger XML structures, and is not fast. JDOM performs
well but is still beaten by something as simple as XmlWriter, both in terms
of CPU [reported to me that it is about twice the speed] and in memory.
